In this section there are some of the features of this cms, like including an extern file, using sources, and using the `go` attribute.
This is an example of how including an extern file, with Syntax Highlighting :P

You can use the following syntax:
#id&page=name.php
or: 
#page=name.php
name.php: name of the page in /stat
The output is not the source, but what the server says getting the PHP page. Here's an example:

Using `go` attribute. As you can see, you can also include a file using:
#id&page=pageRef

where pageRef is a link of a file in /stat :P

You can find here all the officials modules for misTET.

This is the security module. When you use it for the first time, go on #module=security&login, and type "password" (without quotes). Then go on `#module=security&changePassword` and choose your new password. The password is located in config.php.

Possibly actions:
#module=security&login -> logging in
#module=security&connected -> chech if you're logged
#module=security&logout -> logout
#module=security&changePassword -> change your password

This is the blog module for mistet. As you can see, is simple, very simle, just something to write some news on your site.

Options:
#module=blog: display all posts
#module=blog&id=idN: display the post with the specified id
#module=blog&id=idN&del: delete the post with the specified id
#module=blog&id=idN&edit: edit the post with the specified id
#module=blog&show: show all posts with the options of editing and deleting
#module=blog&post: post a news

The blog module requires the security module, since all the functions above works only with it.

With this module you can get a syntax highlighter on your misTET based site.
What you have to do is create a `pre` tag, with the id `lan=language`, where language is the language to highlight. Then the module will do all the rest.
P.S: use the `args` attribute in pages.xml, with `lan=language` as content to link a source.

This is the logging module.

/modules/logger/logger.php?read: read the log as a xml file
Event.observe(res, "event", function() { misTET.modules.logger.execute(args) })

use this to observe an event and log it. args must be an array
